title: Realistic hands/arms for all 3 weapons + improved shotgun & pistol models

requirements.summary: Add visible first-person hands and arms for all three weapons with anatomically correct grip positioning
acceptanceCriteria: Pistol view model shows a right hand gripping the pistol handle and a partially visible forearm
Shotgun view model shows both hands on the shotgun (trigger hand and pump hand) with visible forearms
Assault rifle view model retains existing hands/arms and they remain correctly positioned
Hand and arm geometry is visible in first-person perspective during idle, aim, fire, and reload states
Skin-toned mesh is used consistently across all three weapons

file_operations.description: Add procedural hand and arm geometry for pistol using Three.js primitives (BoxGeometry, CylinderGeometry) positioned to show a right hand gripping the pistol handle with a visible forearm extending toward the camera. Position hand at approximately [-0.15, -0.3, -0.4] with appropriate rotation to grip the pistol handle, and add a cylindrical forearm extending back toward the camera. Use skin-toned material (#d4a373) for all hand/arm meshes.

Add procedural two-handed grip geometry for shotgun using Three.js primitives (BoxGeometry, CylinderGeometry) showing both hands with visible forearms. Position trigger hand at approximately [-0.15, -0.25, -0.35] gripping the stock/trigger area, and pump hand at approximately [-0.1, -0.2, -0.6] gripping the pump forend. Add cylindrical forearms for both hands extending toward the camera. Use skin-toned material (#d4a373) matching the pistol hand color.

Verify and ensure assault rifle view model retains existing hand/arm geometry and that hands remain correctly positioned during idle, fire, and reload animation states. Adjust hand positions if needed to maintain consistent anatomical positioning with the two-handed rifle grip style.

requirements.summary: Redesign shotgun view model to be significantly more realistic with recognizable pump-action silhouette
acceptanceCriteria: Shotgun has a long cylindrical barrel
Shotgun has a distinct pump forend (sliding grip section under the barrel)
Shotgun has a visible receiver/body block
Shotgun has a stock extending toward the camera
Shotgun has a trigger guard detail
Overall proportions match a real-world pump-action shotgun (e.g., Mossberg 500 style)

file_operations.description: Replace the existing shotgun geometry in WeaponViewModel.tsx with a realistic pump-action shotgun model built from Three.js primitives. Create a long cylindrical barrel (CylinderGeometry, length ~0.6, radius ~0.03) positioned forward, a distinct pump forend (BoxGeometry or CylinderGeometry, ~0.15 length) under the barrel for the sliding grip section, a rectangular receiver body block (BoxGeometry, ~0.2 x 0.1 x 0.08) behind the barrel, a stock (BoxGeometry or combined boxes, extending ~0.3 toward camera), and a small trigger guard detail (thin BoxGeometry or TorusGeometry). Use metallic dark material for barrel/receiver and wood-toned material (#8B4513) for stock and forend. Ensure overall proportions match Mossberg 500 style and that upgrade tier glow overlays continue to work.

requirements.summary: Redesign pistol view model to be significantly more realistic with recognizable semi-automatic silhouette
acceptanceCriteria: Pistol has a rectangular slide on top
Pistol has a short barrel protruding from the slide
Pistol has a frame and grip handle angled downward
Pistol has a visible trigger guard
Pistol has a magazine base visible at the bottom of the grip
Overall proportions match a real-world semi-automatic pistol (e.g., Glock-style)

file_operations.description: Replace the existing pistol geometry in WeaponViewModel.tsx with a realistic semi-automatic pistol model built from Three.js primitives. Create a rectangular slide on top (BoxGeometry, ~0.15 x 0.04 x 0.03), a short barrel protruding from the slide front (CylinderGeometry, length ~0.08, radius ~0.008), a frame and grip handle angled downward (BoxGeometry, ~0.12 height, angled ~15 degrees back), a small trigger guard (thin BoxGeometry or TorusGeometry positioned in front of grip), and a magazine base visible at the bottom of the grip (BoxGeometry, ~0.03 x 0.05 x 0.02). Use dark metallic material (#2a2a2a) for slide/barrel and black polymer material (#1a1a1a) for frame/grip. Ensure overall proportions match Glock-style and that upgrade tier glow overlays continue to work.
